docs.title: PyCuVSLAM ROS2 Documentation
docs.text:
Welcome to the PyCuVSLAM ROS2 documentation! This documentation provides an overview of the PyCuVSLAM ROS2 package, including installation instructions, usage examples, and API references.

For installation instructions, please refer to the Installation Guide.

For usage examples, please refer to the Usage Guide.

For API references, please refer to the API Reference.

docs.title: Node
docs.text: The main node for the PyCuVSLAM ROS2 package is pycuvslam_node. This node is responsible for processing images and generating 3D point clouds.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
• param1: Description of parameter 1.
  • param2: Description of parameter 2.

docs.title: Services
docs.text:
The following services are available in the PyCuVSLAM ROS2 package:

  • Service1: Description of service 1.
  • Service2: Description of service 2.

docs.title: Topics
docs.text:
The following topics are published by the PyCuVSLAM ROS2 package:

  • Topic1: Description of topic 1.
  • Topic2: Description of topic 2.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before installing the PyCuVSLAM ROS2 package, ensure you have the following prerequisites:

  • ROS2 installed (Humble Hawksbill or later)
  • Python 3.8 or later
  • OpenCV
  • PCL (Point Cloud Library)

docs.title: Installation Steps
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository:
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/pycuvslam-ros2.git
  1. Navigate to the workspace:
cd pycuvslam-ros2
  1. Install dependencies:
rosdep install -y --from-paths src --ignore-src --rosdistro $ROS_DISTRO
  1. Build the package:
colcon build
  1. Source the setup file:
source install/setup.bash

docs.title: Running the Node
docs.text:
To run the PyCuVSLAM ROS2 node, use the following command:

ros2 run pycuvslam pycuvslam_node

docs.title: Launching the Node
docs.text:
You can also launch the node using a launch file:

ros2 launch pycuvslam pycuvslam_launch.py

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
The node can be configured using parameters. Here is an example of how to set parameters when launching the node:

ros2 launch pycuvslam pycuvslam_launch.py param1:=value1 param2:=value2
